Package com.example.omninventory

Class ItemValue

java.lang.Object
com.example.omninventory.ItemValue
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class ItemValue extends Object implements Serializable
A standard representation of the 'Value' field of an InventoryItem. In different places of the code, currency value may be represented as a numeric value or as a String. This class stores a Long value of cents representing a currency value, and has methods to convert back and forth between String and Long representation (which come in handy for input validation). Many of the methods here are small and fairly redundant. They are implemented to make this class as convenient a tool for standardization and conversion as possible in the rest of the app.
See Also:

    • compare

      public int compare(ItemValue ie)
      Compares two ItemValue objects, and returns 0 if same value. If this object value greater than ie's value, return 1. If this object's value less than ie's value, return -1.
      Parameters:
      ie - The ItemVlue object to compare to
      Returns:
      1 if value greater than ie.value, 0 if value == ie.value, -1 if value less than ie.value

    • numToString

      public static String numToString(Long x)
      Convert a Long value of cents to a String representation of a currency value.
      Parameters:
      x - The Long value of cents.
      Returns:
      A String representing the currency value.

    • stringToNum

      public static Long stringToNum(String x)
      Convert a String representing a currency value to a Long number of cents. This method should never throw an error for invalid input; it strictly ignores any non-digit characters in the String. Examples: "$1.23" -> 123L (represents $1.23) "012A34" -> 1234L (represents $12.34) "123xxxxxxx45" -> 12345L (represents $123.45)
      Parameters:
      x - The String representing a currency value.
      Returns:
      A Long representing the equivalent number of cents.

    • makeValidString

      public static String makeValidString(String x)
      Converts a string in any format to a string in currency format.
      Parameters:
      x - Unformatted string.
      Returns:
      String representing a currency amount.
